personalInfo.splInterest: Cooking, drinking wine, yoga, restaurants, spending time with family and friends
personalInfo.clubAffl: Hazelmere Golf and Tennis Club (Surrey, British Columbia, Canada)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Additional Qualifying Tournament Finisher or Finished 76-100 on 2014 Web.com Tour Money List
tourBios.carHigh:
Has played Gateway Tour, High Five Tour and Vancouver Golf Tour.

2014: Earned his first PGA TOUR Canada victory at the TOUR Championship of Canada, shooting a final-round 68 to win by one over Clayton Rask and Adam Cornelson. Made birdie on the 71st hole to tie Rask for the lead then secured the win with a two-putt par as Rask made bogey at the final hole...Opened seventh season on Tour at The Syncrude Boreal Open with rounds of 67-65 to finish solo fourth. Made first cut of the year and claimed first top-10 with a 15-under 273...In seventh start of the season, closed with three consecutive rounds of 67 to finish T10 at the ATB Financial Classic...Finished sixth on the final Order of Merit, earning an exemption into the final stage of Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament...Was T71 at the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December. His up-and-down performance featured rounds of 72-70-69-80-69-66.
tourBios.personal: Played junior hockey for the Richmond Sockeyes, Surrey Eagles and the Bay County Blizzard of the CEHL...Coach is PGA TOUR Canada alum and European Seniors Tour player Phil Jonas...Lists finishing second at the 2013 Cape Breton Celtic Classic as his biggest thrill in golf and says playing junior hockey in Bay City, Mich., was his biggest thrill outside golf...Favorite courses are the Four Seasons Punta Mina, The Hideaway and Royal Montreal GC...Never travels without his headphones...Favorite college teams are the USC Trojans and Oregon Ducks, and his favorite pro team is the New England Patriots...Favorite TV shows are "The Walking Dead" and "Californication."...Favorite movies are "The Wolf of Wall Street," "Heat," "Man on Fire" and "The Godfather"...Favorite artists are Michael Buble, Coldplay and Justin Timberlake. Favorite books are Putting Out of Your Mind and Tom Brady vs. The NFL...Favorite foods are tacos, lamb chops and ribeye steak, and his top athletes to watch are Brady and Pavel Datsyuk...Favorite cities to visit are Los Angeles and San Diego, and he enjoys vacationing in Puerto Vallarta, San Diego and San Francisco....Keeps power bars and dried fruit in his bag as snacks...Non-related golf jobs held include cabinet maker...Dream foursome would include Brady, Woods and Al Pacino...Most famous person he has met is Gary Player at The Presidents Cup in Montreal...Not many people know he did not start playing golf seriously until 2005...Bucket list includes playing Augusta National and winning on the PGA TOUR...Personal motto is "Work hard, play hard."...Twitter handle is @rdubgolf.

tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Started the season at the PC Financial Open in his hometown of Vancouver with a T7 finish...Carded solid rounds at Point Grey G&CC with 70-71-70-67... Continued solid play at the Bayview Place Island Savings Open, where he claimed a T15 finish... Saved his best play for last, going 54 holes without a bogey at the season-ending Freedom 55 Financial Championship... In defense of his 2014 title at the Highland CC, matched Jason Millard's 265 score to force a playoff, before falling to Millard on the first playoff hole...Finished 14th on the Order of Merit to earn an exemption into the Web.com Tour's second stage of their Qualifying Tournament.

 

2014: Earned his first Mackenzie Tour victory at the TOUR Championship of Canada, shooting a final-round 68 to win by one over Clayton Rask and Adam Cornelson. Made birdie on the 71st hole to tie Rask for the lead, then secured the win with a two-putt par as Rask made bogey at the final hole....Opened seventh season on tour at The Syncrude Boreal Open with rounds of 67-65 to finish solo fourth. Made first cut of the year and claimed first top-10 with a 15-under 273...In seventh start of the season, closed with three straight rounds of 67 to T10 at the ATB Financial Classic...Finished sixth on the final Order of Merit, earning an exemption into the final stage of Web.com Tour Qualifying School...Represented the Mackenzie Tour at the inaugural Bridgestone America's Golf Cup, teaming with Michael Gligic to finish T25th. 



2013: Finished second to Mackenzie Hughes at the Cape Breton Celtic Classic, narrowly missing an eagle putt that would have forced a playoff. 



2012: Made five cuts in seven starts. Was the co-leader after the first round of the ATB Financial Classic before finishing T3...Finished T8 at The Players Cup. 



2011: Made eight cuts in 12 starts, including a T3 at the Seaforth Country Classic...Added another top-five, a T5 at the Desert Dunes Classic. 

2010: Made seven cuts in 10 starts, with a season-best T26 finish at the Times Colonist Open. 

2009: Made six cuts in 13 starts, with his best finish a T4 performance at the Desjardins Montreal Open. 

2008: Missed all eight cuts in his first season on Tour2015: Started the season at the PC Financial Open in his hometown of Vancouver with a T7 finish...Carded solid rounds at Point Grey G&CC with 70-71-70-67... Continued solid play at the Bayview Place Island Savings Open, where he claimed a T15 finish... Made first cut of the year and claimed first top-10 with a 15-under 273...In seventh start of the season, closed with three straight rounds of 67 to T10 at the ATB Financial Classic...Finished sixth on the final Order of Merit, earning an exemption into the final stage of Web.com Tour Qualifying School...Represented the Mackenzie Tour at the inaugural Bridgestone America's Golf Cup, teaming with Michael Gligic to finish T25th. 



2013: Finished second to Mackenzie Hughes at the Cape Breton Celtic Classic, narrowly missing an eagle putt that would have forced a playoff.

tourBios.personal: Played junior hockey for the Richmond Sockeyes, Surrey Eagles and the Bay County Blizzard of the CEHL...Works with Mackenzie Tour alumni and European Seniors Tour player Phil Jonas... Says playing junior hockey in Bay City, Mich., was his biggest thrill outside golf...Favorite courses are the Four Seasons Punta Mina, The Hideaway and Royal Montreal GC. Would most like to play Augusta National and Cypress Point...Never travels without his headphones...Favorite college teams are the USC Trojans and Oregon Ducks, and his favorite pro team is the New England Patriots...Favorite TV shows are "The Walking Dead" and "Californication."...Favorite movies are "The Wolf of Wall Street," "Heat," "Man on Fire" and "The Godfather"...Favorite artists are Michael Buble, Coldplay and Justin Timberlake. Favorite books are Putting Out of Your Mind and Tom Brady vs. The NFL...Favorite foods are tacos, lamb chops and ribeye steak and top athletes to watch are Brady, Tiger Woods and Pavel Datsyuk...Favorite cities to visit are Los Angeles and San Diego, and he enjoys vacationing in Puerto Vallarta, San Diego and San Francisco...Twitter handle is @rdubgolf...Keeps power bars and dried fruit in his bag as snacks...Dream foursome would include Brady, Woods and Al Pacino...Not many people know he did not start playing golf seriously until 2005...Bucket list includes playing Augusta National and winning on the PGA TOUR...Personal motto is "Work hard, play hard."
